revised_title: Conjugation of Resting Nuclei in Epithelioma: Observations in a Mouse Tumor
tldr: The authors investigate the cell proliferation and conjugation of resting nuclei in an epithelioma of a mouse. They observe that the tumor growth is a phenomenon unparalleled in mammalia and study the growth of tumors at successive stages of 24 hours, finding conjugation of resting nuclei in a tumor removed on the eighth day.
